definitions.definition: A member of certain so self-styled Novatian and other medieval Christian sects embracing a form of dualism and extraordinary practices purportedly adhering to Mary Magdalene 's teachings, persecuted by Roman Catholics as heretics .
examples: The Albigenses, famous Cathars in and around Albi (southern France), were eradicated in a bloody ‘crusade’.

main_definition: A member of certain so self-styled Novatian and other medieval Christian sects embracing a form of dualism and extraordinary practices purportedly adhering to Mary Magdalene 's teachings, persecuted by Roman Catholics as heretics .
